alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 9:52AM MST until March 02 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 85 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to Noon MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Lane blockages are possible, especially in prone areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas along and west of United States Highway 89 corridor from Choteau to the International Border have the highest likelihood of seeing blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
